_comment: Created by JMorris on 09/05/2018 14:37:48 using v2.7
title: How has the number of people waiting over 52 weeks to start treatment changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
The number of patients still waiting for treatment over 52 weeks after referral (incomplete pathway) reached a high of 21,098 patients in April 2010, but fell dramatically between September 2011 and December 2012. Since then, the number of patients has remained comparatively low, reaching a low of 214 patients in November 2013. However, over the past three years the number of people waiting over 52 weeks has gradually increased from 442 patients in February 2015 to 2,236 patients in February 2018.

Updated April 2018.
data_source: NHS England, Referral to Treatment waiting times
